meanings.definition: The inability to distinguish certain colors.
meanings.sent1: His colorblindness made it difficult for him to tell the difference between red and green.
meanings.sent2: She struggled with colorblindness, often mistaking blue for purple.
meanings.sent3: During the art class, his colorblindness led to a hilarious mix-up of paint colors.
meanings.sent4: To her, the world seemed like a black and white movie due to her colorblindness.
meanings.sent5: The vividness of the sunset was lost on him because of his colorblindness.

meanings.definition: A condition in which a person cannot see colors accurately.
meanings.sent1: Colorblindness can make traffic lights confusing for some individuals.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed him with colorblindness after a series of tests.
meanings.sent3: His colorblindness caused a funny mix-up when he tried to match his socks.
meanings.sent4: In her world, colorblindness turned everything into a dull and muted palette.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the rainbow was lost on him due to his colorblindness.
